verses.verse: There is no advantage for me to now brag, so I will move on to visions and revelations from the Lord.
I know a man in Christ 14 years ago (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or out of the body, I cannot tell. God knows). This one was taken up to the third heaven.
I know such a man (if in the body or out of body, I just don't know), [but] God knows.
How that he was taken into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which are not lawful for a man to talk about.
Of this one will I boast, yet of myself I will not boast, just in my weaknesses.

For even if I would like to brag, I'm not going to be a fool, but I will speak the truth, but now I will not, fearing somebody would think more of me then what he sees me to be or what he hears about me.
So that I wouldn't be lifted up by pride--because of the many revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to repeatedly punch me, lest I would be arrogant.
I plead with the Lord about this three times, so that it might leave me.
He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for my strength is made complete in weakness." Therefore I would rather gladly boast in my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ might rest on me.
Therefore I find pleasure in weaknesses, in insults, in distress, in persecutions, in calamities because of Christ, for when I am weak, then am I strong.
I have become a fool in boasting; you have forced me, when I should have been commended by you, for I am not one speck less then those super apostles, though I am a nobody.
Truly the signs of an apostle were fully done among you in full patience, in signs, wonders, and mighty works.
How is it that you were inferior to other congregations, except in that I, myself, was not a burden to you; would you forgive me for that?

Look, I am ready to come to you this third time, and I will not be a burden to you, for I am not seeking your [stuff] but you. For the children shouldn't have to provide for the parents but parents for the children.
I will very gladly wear myself out for you and be exhausted for you even though the more I love you, the less you love me.
But so be it. I did not make myself a burden to you, nevertheless being crafty, "I caught you with deception."
Did I profit off you by any of those whom I sent to you?
I requested Titus, and I sent a brother with him. Did Titus make a profit off you? Didn't we walk in the same spirit? Didn't we follow the same steps.
So again, do you think that we making excuses to you? We are speaking in God's sight, in Christ, and dearly beloved we do everything for your edification.

For I am afraid that when I come, I will not find you as I would want, and that I will be found by you as you wouldn't want with debates, envyings, strong anger, fighting, mouthing off, talking behind somebody's back, bragging, [and] chaos.

And fearing when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and I will grieve over many who have already sinned and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and uncontrollable lust which they have done.
